zRxz0a0W1MOisWQqF3NgIw.text: Typically stellar food and service from Dishoom. Very nicely done up on the inside here. Mutton curry was really flavourful. Portions are a little small, and it can be hard to get a reservation. Would like a bit more variety in the curries.

GRjtY0vO_gKUo8JOhWYjDg.text: I was so excited to try this place. We were not disappointed! We were told we would have to wait 30 minutes for a table but only ended up waiting like 15 minutes. They are really fast here! The service was very good and the food amazing! We went with the veggie samosas, the ruby chicken and one of the rice dishes and garlic naan !! We loved every bit!! The decor and music was so lovely. I wish our time in London wasn't close to ending because I would love to go back to Dishoom for another great meal!!

tJA_CrNzQRJgrj3-_vXftg.text: I am a big fan of Indian cuisine and was in the neighborhood with a coworker, so we opted for Dishoom. The two of us arrived a little early (6 pm), so it wasn't very crowded.  I had the Ruby Chicken and my friend ordered a Tikka dish, and split several smaller dishes and a bottle of merlot between us. The waiter was great, knew the menu well, and checked back with us several times. By the time we left (8 pm) it was very busy. My overall impression was very good, although a bit pricey, I would eat there again. Nice decor.

gIoK6LBgpIsqUyAQgOVfRQ.text: This restaurant was good overall! We got the mataar pannee which was good, the ruby chicken which was delicious, the gunpowder potatoes which were good, and the black daal which was okay. Overall I felt I was satisfied and had a yummy meal coming to this place

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Kensington - Kensington, London, United Kingdom. Mango lassi - good, but not amazing

i5ZardvRSCDihire15D3ZA.text: Seems like a mix of Indian and Middle Eastern.  Place is much as ambience as food.  Nice open stylish space with incredibly high ceiling, art deco decor with jazz music playing in background.Service was very friendly and helpful. Food is tasty.  I thought portions were on smallish side but definitely tasty and well prepared.Definitely the trendiest Indian place I have gone to.

iqXGbVH2lA5v7wmCp_7oyw.text: What can I say? I wanted amazing Indian food while in London and I definitely got it here. We ordered what felt like half the menu so I'll spare you the essay. Excellent well flavored and balanced food, delicious and well made cocktails, and a very knowledgeable and helpful server made for a great dining experience. I will return!

Pf38hprC8SlDYsnLVLc6rQ.text: Such an amazing and special find. Amazingly friendly and considerate staff. Endless porridge (upon request), amazing chai, amazing yogurt, and obviously the bacon naan roll. The bun maska is a bun slathered in butter and comes with its own chai for only 20p more than just the chai alone, so it's definitely worth the purchase. The interior of the restaurant is also stunning in itself. Please strongly consider stopping by, even for a quick bite, if you have the time!

GAOLPzZzVwjqcYocfk4Tgg.text: Yummy, not spicy. My favorite in all of London Indian cuisine. All the good taste of Indian food without the spice. Some interesting twists too. Highly recommended

0LhmFNaroshYH53qObJ-NQ.text: THIS PLACE IS GOOD. Location , menu , music , washrooms , live music  - the list goes on. Worth it.

JPT1C9g5slpklns4mCzmYw.text: The best restaurant I have been in a while. Services was exceptional, the cocktails had a new twist, food was amazing, location was easy to get to, the places was kitschy and fun. 100 percent recommend this places!!!

CVkNMin645AVhJscCMlUbw.text: Ambiance was excellent, service was good but I was anticipating the "awesome" Indian food everyone brags about that they have in the UK. What a disappointment!!! Not spicy, dry biryani with little meat, chai was good though. Might need to find a ghetto authentic spot for tomorrow night. Any recommendations!???!

Xq0caU9ZdoMVPtzpoQi2GA.text: We have been traveling through Europe for 2 1/2 weeks.  Food at Dishoom was unbelievable!  Wait staff was fantastic and the food was beyond exceptional!   We had theater tickets, and were in a bit of a rush.  The staff executed a perfect meal for us and was perfection!   Best Indian food I have ever had!   Added bonus:  Dishoom donates a meal to a hungry child for each meal you purchase.   Can't say enough great things about this restaurant!

KBdcDLXBJpheXN6DFQyYjw.text: My boyfriend and I were visiting London and we were SO excited to try Dishoom and WERE NOT disappointed! I recommend making a reservation. The staff was extremely friendly upon arrival. The "dining hall" was complete with 50s/60s decor and even live music! The food was amazing, the service was top of the line, and the drinks were great. Navid/Naveed our server provided the best recommendations, both with the food menu, dessert menu, and drink menu (to pair with our food). I have friends traveling to London soon and I have already highly recommended they visit Dishoom Kensington, where we dined. Thank you for a fabulous dining experience! One of our top 3 out of our entire 2 weeks abroad!

3vytBmj6G0ePzV9hB76O2g.text: Super fun place. We had to wait about 30 min at 6:00 pm on a Sunday night. They served wonderful chai tea to those waiting in line. Once seated the service was quick and efficient. The food was great as well. I would rate almost 4.5 stars but I hate to wait in line.

-E_8LCdHizrumICEuYlrIA.text: Oh man, where do I begin? Dishoom has been our list of restaurants to try while we spent two weeks in London. We knew the food was going to be delicious but the ENTIRE experience, from the moment we walked in the door until the end of our meal, was nothing but five star. The staff was not only pleasant but incredibly accommodating of our 2 year old. Nothing but smiles and "no problems"! The atmosphere can't be beat, either. A jazz trio happened to be playing during this visit and it just added to the 'Darjeeling Limited' vibe. The manager was more than lovely and urged us to come back for breakfast....little does she know that we will be back for all three meals very soon!

Z3crwfgnXGNVxXp_19QdWA.text: Absolutely unbelievable. The best Indian food I've ever had, hands down. My boyfriend and I were craving Indian before our flight back to the states, and we met somebody in Florence that recommended Dishoom. Right when we arrived we were told there was a short wait and were directed to the bar. Such a cool set up and atmosphere, we enjoyed our drinks and had no problem waiting the 10 or so minutes it took to seat us. The waiter was very helpful and explained the whole menu to us, as it was our first visit. We got the lamb samosas and calamari to start. Both were flavored perfectly and cooked extremely well. The calamari was crispy and not too chewy. The sauces were all great, it was nice to have a variety of flavors and level of spiciness. After, we got the chicken ruby which was an amazing curry that I'm literally still dreaming about. The flavors were off the charts, so rich and went perfectly with the garlic naan. We also got a potato dish-- I don't remember what it was called-- which was awesome. The potatoes weren't too crispy and weren't too soft, spiced perfectly-- a little lemon flavor but not too much. Absolutely outstanding meal, seriously one of the best meals of my life. I would come back to London just to eat at this place. On our way out each member of the staff said goodbye and were so kind! I'd give it six stars if I could.

BVHoO4pkXwY9N5DwXwTbMg.text: They have a vegan menu and serve vegan breakfast every day till 11:45! If you're in the area make sure to give this place a visit, it's got a very nice ambiance inside as well.

3KSI6rbTvwqkTmfVBRjQfg.text: Visited walkthrough at lunchtime weekend with my wife. Staff was so attentive to explain her recommendations kindly that I can fully understand overall. Food were all excellent started from fried Okura, and then chin tika to curries, everything was so nice.

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Kensington - Kensington, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Dishoom - Kensington - Kensington, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Dishoom - Kensington - Kensington, London, United Kingdom

jl1guYl7IrK3YWu6PrRyLg.text: I think the starting premise with Dishoom is that there is a lot of hype. I lived in London for over 4 years without ever dining at one of their locations, not for lack of trying. Very few things are worth a two hour wait when you are hungry. However, now that they have expanded their presence to new corners of London, this has finally shifted the supply/demand imbalance and I was able to make a booking for this new location with a group of 8 on a weekday evening.Being Dishoom newbies, we largely ordered what the server recommended, which ended up being the lamb samosas, murgh malai, masala prawns, jackfruit biryani, mattar paneer, chicken ruby, the chef's special (a lamb stir fry), bowl of greens, the roti, and a lot of garlic and cheese naan. As a regular patron of South Asian restaurants in London but not a connoisseur, nothing was particularly unique to the point of writing home about, but they were all tasty.However, what does stand out is the spectacular venue, which is right off Kensington High Street with an impressive entrance and high ceilings in an Art Deco building. They seem to have a balcony where a band could play, but there was no live music while we were there. Dishoom bridges the gap in the London restaurant scene between BYOs in Whitechapel and the Michelin star Indian establishments in Mayfair. It's worth a visit, but not a wait. I would note that at this location there wasn't a queue out the door, so I don't think it would be that difficult to walk in on a weekday evening.

eW5oIpUPkUTMV_NjV1vt_g.text: Absolutely delicious. I honestly did not know if I would like it here since Dishoom is so over-hyped and lines are SO long at every location, but wow was I wrong. Everything that we ate was better than the next. The chicken ruby is out of this world. I cannot wait to come back!! SO worth the wait (which wasn't that long actually, only 45 minutes for 2 people on a Saturday night, and they give you a buzzer so that you can post up at the bar). This was the best Indian food I've had in London and I highly recommend it.

mU9EzACM4RkuIozasxN3HQ.text: This place was a welcomed spot for lunch after walking in the cold rainy London streets.  It's in an Art Deco building and has a bit of that 40's big screen glamour. The waiter was exceptionally helpful in highlighting the dishes and helping me decide.  I had a smorgasbord of small but filling plates that really warmed me after that very chilly walk and paired it with a very nice Cabernet.  I finished it off with some very fragrant mint tea and was ready to keep exploring.

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Kensington - Kensington, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Dishoom - Kensington - Kensington, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Dishoom - Kensington - Kensington, London, United Kingdom

RYqGkAMXGaK47WXsyB5rGg.text: We wanted Indian food but London has over 27,000+ Indian restaurants. After a bit of research we stumbled upon this delightful place. It was absolutely delicious. The chicken ruby was to die for. Everything was beyond our expectations. Highly highly recommended

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Kensington - Kensington, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Dishoom - Kensington - Kensington, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Dishoom - Kensington - Kensington, London, United Kingdom

NeKjpP0sD4jJEfFoLd93tg.text: We didn't have the chance to eat there No way to make reservation and waiting time is more than an hour Be aware Unacceptable

lm2d3yLdTbtMWJ17-W9IAg.text: Do not leave London without eating here. Everything on the menu is amazing. Service is phenomenal. Recommendations : chicken ruby, lamb samosas, lamb kebab Chocolate chai is great too!

RUOWSouaNEp5AGKx_KxMRQ.text: Super popular restaurant.... always a waiting line outside the door . I came with my friend and waited 25 minutes to enter. The food was nice , we ordered a chicken dish and a fish dish, both good. Price is reasonable, I can see why it's crowded everyday.

FH_czacrtuzvYNOJqciLXw.text: Amazing! Delicious! All the flavors! And the atmosphere is . Highly recommend! My husband and I were pleasantly surprised. We walked right in and we were seated immediately. Our server was very knowledgeable about the menu and helped us make the right choice(s).

I3d2gvgLY1nBD5SDsan14g.text: We absolutely loved this restaurant. The service, food and atmosphere was busy and fun! My friend loved their spiciest dishes while I had a medium spiced dish.

CXJMK6erUV5Qj1sfxQSadA.text: And I thought I would not be surprised by better Indian food in London, How wrong was I!! Nested in a side street to Kensington High in London is the chic art-deco establishment of Dishoom. Much less crowded than its central London counter part, without a reservation I was in an seated within just a few minutes. With ample seating space and lively atmosphere the place accommodates the large group as well as the diner-a-la-solo. The concept is "street-food Bombay" with good variety of choices that is sure to please the carnivore and the veggie eater. Portions are small, order some 3 plates per person. The Black dal dish IS MADE IN HEAVEN, an entourage of perfectly balanced spices invade your palate with a punch of buttery flavor, smooth and creamy, fragrant and just delicious. I had the lamb boti kabab, super tender lamb well marinated in a citrus base that gave it the gentle kick of acid to go with the rich sauce of red chilly, garlic and ginger. Together with a freshly made fluffy garlic Nan bread and an ice cold Kingfisher, this was a feast of flavor difficult to top. Moderately priced (its London Ok) with excellent service and outstanding cuisine, Dishoom deserves more stars that Yelp gives. I will absolutely come back to be further surprised by the creative deliciousness and  simplicity of its dishes.

pmvxFapJeYvjd6mrAl0xWQ.text: I am going to begin with saying this is a great place but its overrated. The menu is small but a great one. The food is great, the ambience is lovely, the decor is kinda different and it has a spacious seating area. I must say that the portion sizes are really small and its expensive for that. 2 people dinner with no alcohol, 80 pounds. You do the math! It's definitely worth going once to this place but it's a bit over rated.

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Kensington - Kensington, London, United Kingdom. Lovely ambience at dishoom Kensington.

kqg3DCTJ9M5yKowjZDPaWg.text: Somehow we got in without a wait after trying at the convent garden location numerous times. IT WAS SO GOOD!!!!!! I now get why the line is so long. We had a little bit of everything and were super impressed. It's definitely not your home cooked Indian food, it's very elevated but I definitely loved everything I ate. We basically had to roll ourselves out of there we ate so much. The service was great even though it was crazy busy. I wish I lived in London so that I could come here all the time. Oh and btw the chicken ruby was one of the best dishes I've ever had!!!!

oNrVW_SqODK9aE5-3BSkJg.text: Ambience-5 Stars - Tasteful done; Great Love Band with a very eclectic crowd.Drinks - Great selection. Great mixes Service -5 Stars: It seems the food comes straight from the frying pan to you in minutes.Menu - True to description. The mutton pepper Fry is outstanding. Tried the fried Okra as well as their desserts.

KfmkiVKODvbVLb5n8wDCVA.text: Absolutely spectacular food. They have great chicken tikka masala as well as cheese stuffed naan. There's a nice, dark atmosphere with fake candles. This place gets pretty busy but the servers do a good job of stopping and helping by tables that aren't their own as well. Highly recommend this place; one of my favorite meals in London!

IC3g7CQzHtmU-3etIJOyjw.text: quite good, with a distinct British flavor.  the restaurant has a lot of seats. reminded me more of a 50s style restaurant.  had the breakfast sausage naan, grilled tomatoes, and chocolate chai which were quite good.

P-kBs5mdigZ3irZTRhU8Tw.text: This place is AMAZING! The atmosphere is so fun and lively. Service was so wonderful, even though they were busy... they were still soooooo fast. We had the tikki chicken which was the most delicious chicken and the ruby curry. Best curry I've ever had. We will most definitely fly back to London to eat here again. Also, Mark was such an amazing server. He was so lovely to talk to and gave us such a amazing overview of the menu. He honestly made our experience so much better. :)

me-ooVNiIiHY14CtATgaEg.text: Really not worth an hour's wait. As a person of South Asian heritage I find the foods okay. Felt like a fish market.

AksScIb2YS-XnFe1sjKJIw.text: Loved this place. Great ambience, terrific service and absolutely spot on food. Tried several items on the menu from chicken tikka to lamb chops and the house specialty mashed veg and everything was so so good. I would love to go back. Good cocktails as well.

wIrUYdQJLtWAcN-rznCR3Q.text: Excellent service and ambiance The Bombay omelette (original taste )The bun in chai , sweet and filling Chicken livers cooked perfectly

gck3YErxql-zQHCLVuUJVw.text: A decent Indian restaurant with a weird theme:   1920/30's Art Deco/Persian cafe.  The incense here was a bit much for a food place, but at least the theme was consistent throughout the whole place.This is a very popular place.  Long waits seemingly every night.   We drank at the bar while waiting for our table.   Drinks made here were pretty solid with a line of bartenders banging out drinks.The table service here is pretty meh.   I watched our server this night trying really hard not to work.   The food was pretty good.   Notable favorites were the Marsala shrimp, the minced lamb and roll starter and the black daal, the daal being far and away the best thing we had.The tikka paneer was really lacking flavor and not great.   The biryanis rice was okay.   Some decent food to be had here but a few clunkers. I probably wouldn't rush to come back especially because of the huge wait times.  Oh, I should mention there were tons of Americans eating here so maybe this place is not for locals???

aVfOahLeF2wd0b1JznJmHA.text: Yet another great Dishoom. Same delicious menu, same unique style.Bonus points for great news from a server: The Dishoom owners are considering expansion to NYC, and are taking a trip there soon to scout out the market.Demerits for an item on the bill we didn't order, though they promptly removed it when we called it to their attention.

UbqIxkqDMI9uBDB2w9X_dA.text: My friends and I met at Dishoom for a late dinner, and we had a fantastic experience. Dishoom is one of the best Indian restaurants in London. I highly suggest ordering the prawns, chicken rugby, calamari, fried okra, and black daal. Don't forget the garlic naan. It's fantastic. I don't think that you could go wrong with any item on the Dishoom menu. Everything is extremely fresh and cooked to perfection. You'd be a fool to not try Indian food at Dishoom. It's simply divine and life-changing.

X1aeNrx2tQ28vtXPkoLO_w.text: We ordered the house chai and colaba colada to drink. The waitress was very helpful in the suggestions she made for our dinner. We ordered the vegetable samosas and they were delicious with all 3 sauces that were given. It was a great way to start dinner.We ordered the plain naan, steamed basmati rice, murgh malai, and spicy lamb chops. It is served to share. We split it between us and we were just the right amount of full. The Murgh malai was not spicy which is what I wanted. The spicy lamb chops are medium spice that hits you afterwards.We also ordered mango and malai kulfi. It was so light and refreshing. It was a great way to end our dinner.Our waitress was fantastic. She made splendid recommendations and continued to be helpful. We appreciated her guidance.

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Kensington - Kensington, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Dishoom - Kensington - Kensington, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Dishoom - Kensington - Kensington, London, United Kingdom. Last dinner in London

BhP5Ylyl3SfutQUkAHEhhw.text: WOW! That is all I got to say! The hype for this place completely lives up to it! From the time you walk into the door and until you leave I feel like I am in an upscale restaurant in India. The interior designing is spot on and  the culture inside the restaurant is wonderful! My family ordered a pau bhaji, and because it was so good, we HAD to order TWO more! The vegetable samosas were well filled and very light.  We also ordered the mattar paneer with garlic naan which was very flavorful! Drinks, I got the bollybellini which was nice and fruity. The rose & cardamom and mango & fennel lassis were both delicious but don't expect the cardamom and fennel to be incorporated into the lassi it is more as a garnish to the drink. The service was very accommodating and pleasant. I wish we had more time in London to enjoy another meal!

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Kensington - Kensington, London, United Kingdom. Bollybellini
Photo of Dishoom - Kensington - Kensington, London, United Kingdom. Rose & cardamom lassi, mango & fennel lassi
Photo of Dishoom - Kensington - Kensington, London, United Kingdom. Garlic naan

nrfknzjRRgh7_GL0i4WCSw.text: Best Indian food in London! I received several recommendations from friends and Dishoom did not disappoint! They are handicap accessible and have excellent customer service. The restaurant was packed! I highly recommend the full size Chef's Kensington Special. The mutton is so tender. The chickpea salad is unlike any salad I've ever had. Out of paratha, roti and naan, the paratha was my favorite. It was difficult picking dessert because all of the options sound delicious. The kala Khatta ice was interesting because it was salty. The kulfi, aka popsicles are yummy. I'm so happy this was my last meal in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Kensington - Kensington, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Dishoom - Kensington - Kensington, London, United Kingdom. Okra fries
Photo of Dishoom - Kensington - Kensington, London, United Kingdom

U0L3A8n8RUppFZ1Uwvp7dw.text: Some local friends took my mom and I here for lunch on our recent visit to London.  It had a great laid back vibe, lots of good food, great decor.  Its decorated in an art decor/old diner style.  We had a variety of food and everything was great.  I started with the warm chai tea.  It had a nice spice to it and the refilled it for free.  I had the lamb kabobs.  These were really tasty but a bit spicy so be warned.  Naan bread on the side.  That was really good.  Nice and buttery.  Mom had the grilled shrimp.  They were in the shell which is a pain but she really liked their flavor.They had a lot of other really great looking Indian food.  Definitely would be a regular spot if I lived in London.

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Kensington - Kensington, London, United Kingdom. Grilled shrimp
Photo of Dishoom - Kensington - Kensington, London, United Kingdom. Naan bread
Photo of Dishoom - Kensington - Kensington, London, United Kingdom. Lamb kabobs

PxmD98nqqWJcmTkUg1zmhg.text: I've been going to Dishoom since 2011 making it a necessary stop on all my trips to London.Breakfast, lunch or dinner- this place does everything right.  Theres enough to choose from whether you're in the mood for light snacks or complete meals.  The menu changes from time to time.  On this visit I had the Spicy Lamb Chops and Ruby Chicken (which is like a version of butter chicken.). Flavors are amazing, the meat is tender and its apparent they've taken time to marinate with quality spices.The prices are very reasonable given the quality of ingredients and atmosphere of the restaurant.  My advice- skip the dodgy £6 curry joints and pay a little more for the quality and experience at Dishoom.

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Kensington - Kensington, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Dishoom - Kensington - Kensington, London, United Kingdom
Photo of Dishoom - Kensington - Kensington, London, United Kingdom

B4CVEJZzaPdiUfSvNyyuhg.text: So. There are no reservations unless it's a party of 6 or more.  The host says "we don't want to turn guests away if we're full with reservations"- so they'll turn guests away with an hour wait. Which we had.  Sat at the table. Ordered "Chicken Tikka" and it was BEYOND spicy.  And the food wasn't hot like it had just been cooked- it was warm like it had been on the grill holding. Our waitress didn't even ask us if our food was good until a proper long time after it was brought to the table.  Not to mention the drink she forgot.  It's not what's it's cracked up to be.

ij1pmOVZpDhv-qf5XjRxYw.text: We came back to this place a second time in 3 days  on our visit to London and tried different things both times. Probably one of the best Indian restaurants ever!! I would recommend this spot to anyone in London. I'm comparing this restaurant to Indian restaurants in the US and the food and service both are phenomenal! Their house chai is delicious - the server explained that it is boiled over and over again for 40 mins before serving it. Must try !!

UD-GIzE719tXJAK5-aL8VA.text: Love this place, which serves what they describe as Bombay street food. I came for dinner, but would love to return for their breakfast. There are small plates, appetizers, mains and more, many vegetarian. This is not your typical Indian restaurant and the most fun we had while dining in London. While we dined, a live jazz band played in a loft. The rooms are very lively, and you have the feeling of being back in the era it represents (1940s). I started with Pau Bhaji, which is mashed vegetables served with two buttered hard rolls...delicious. The Black Daal was tasty and substantial. I had a side of Dishoom slaw, a perfect accompaniment. Cocktails and mock tails flow and are wonderful. The food was great, the service was great and the atmosphere fun. What more can you ask for? I hear there are plans to open a Dishoom in NYC. I will definitely make it a priority for dining.

BT3-9fi107Yq_jUFptMcZQ.text: I loved this restaurant, I couldn't have asked for a better first meal in London. This location is particularly cool, the art deco decorations are so classic and just cool. It's a great laid back date night spot, and a great Indian restaurant. If I lived in London I would probably spend all my money ordering this for take away. The service is great, the prices are fair, and I would recommend this restaurant to anyone.  We ordered the following: Chicken Ruby- deliciousMasala Prawns- so deliciousSpicy Lamb Chops- unbelievably delicious Mutton Pepper Fry- delicious Garlic Naan- delicious  Next time we're in town, we'll be back!

suQeLZBqnGLMNWXhlycRqA.text: Our meal at Dishoom was so excellent that we ate at a different location the very next day!  Our server was so sweet.  She was so wonderful that I had her ask the manager to pay me a visit, so I could rave about her.Order the black dhal!  There is a reason this is their specialty.  I am not a fan of dhal usually, but our waitress really recommended it.  It was EXCELLENT!!!  It was so so good =)... Like my husband and I kept talking about it afterwards good.Everything we ordered was delicious.  My son even gobbled up all his grilled fish.  The chai was fantastic.  They offer refills.  I did not know this, and was trying to make my tiny cup last the whole meal.  They even refilled my son's juice.  The cups here are tiny by American standards (maybe 6 oz), so the refills make a difference.  The chicken biryani was very flavorful.  The buttered veggies with hot rolls (I forgot the name) was a good starter, but I would skip it next time.  The absolute must eat is the black dahl!

Sa1ixdFXiPb0hBcft_nDIw.text: Food is a 3.5, but the restaurant itself is a 4. Very cool art-deco interior. I may be totally missing the link to Indian cuisine, or maybe it's an old art-deco building they preserved but in any case, nice decor. I had the ruby chicken and the lamb chops. The waiter described the ruby chicken as the most delicious thing on the menu. It was okay. Kind of sweet. Tastes like there might be a smidge too much tomato paste. The lamb chops were pretty tasty though they definitely need the citrus from the lime that's served with it. It would have been nice to have the option to have them rare. The waiter didn't ask. They were served well-done. The garlic naan was pretty lousy. Definitely not made to order like they say. Mine was cold and didn't have much garlic. Would come back for the ambiance. It is nothing special in terms of the food.

hHKMLIQIHlIG0BVI0oA4kw.text: I would say the BEST Indian food that I have had!! Visiting London and in 3 days, been here twice already. By now, we have probably tried 1/3 of the menu and absolutely nothing has disappointed us. Everything is freaking delicious!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Dishoom - Kensington - Kensington, London, United Kingdom

FkSOZ2CiXPSrpB4iIwEwCQ.text: I was recommended by a friend to check out Dishoom, so I made it one of my top priorities to try Dishoom in London! There's many locations spread out but I decided to stop by this one since we were nearby.The restaurant is definitely nicer. It has a nice, casual vibe to it. We ordered the chicken ruby, mutton pepper fried, garlic naan, rice. The chicken ruby dish was delicious, we really enjoyed it! The curry here is rich, delicious and flavorful.My biggest complaint is that the portions and pricing. I wish it was better buck for your deal, quality is up to par though. Service is good. We did order a dish but they totally forgot it, we didn't mention it until the end though. Overall, a great place to indulge in your Indian cravings in the UK!

y2NXEMcgvQK5NLp0sHZv8g.text: Dined at Dishoom for the first time last week with my family. We had to wait for a little while for our table but we passed the time with drinks and snacks in the bar. Once we were seated, we ordered different dishes to share. Our waitress recommended about 2-3 dishes/person but we ordered 2 and we had plenty! Highly recommend the veggie samosas, dahl, and veggie curry. It was all delicious and wish we had one closer to our home!

OteyZUKSEPcT5eV4Kf8tEw.text: TL;DR: The less busy, touristy version of the Carnaby location that you can walk into with equally good food. Best samosas I've had in US and the UK.Located on a side street off high street Kensington (across from the Equinox, which will taunt you with photos of impossibly chiseled people after you stumble out with a food baby), I was able to walk into this location without a wait on a Sunday afternoon. There are plenty of seats available as it's a multi-level restaurant, and waitstaff was attentive and helpful, suggesting multiple options for me as a first time diner. I got the veggie samosas to start, which was by far the best decision I made. They are about the size of my palm and unlike samosas I've had in the US, these are lightly filled and beautifully crispy. I highly recommend to any diner, vegetarian or not. I also had the paneer curry with basmati rice, and it was perfect; filling, but not overly greasy or heavy, with a nice blend of spices that didn't upset my stomach in the way that some Indian food tends to do.Total cost around 20 pounds, or $26. Not a cheapo Indian option but the quality of food is by far worth it.

db4-fa3mVAY6pJBvDLcIrw.text: One of the best meals I've had in my life! Had tried to go to another Dishoom location, but I'm not the type to stand in a line outside in the sun. Here at Kensington we were informed it would be 45 minutes and were invited to sit at the bar. We had the old fashioned (it was delicious!!!!)They give you a pager so any drinks you order come up on your final bill once you're done drinking & eating. We waited about the estimated time and were seated in view of the awesome band playing upstairs. Since it was my first time having Indian food, our wonderful server explain dishes to me and recommended some. We ordered so many different items, and they were delicious. Go here!
